meanings.definition: The quality or state of being gusty.
meanings.sent1: The gustinesses of the storm made the trees sway wildly.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the gustinesses of the wind as I walked along the beach.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a disaster due to the unexpected gustinesses of the weather.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a gustinesses that filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The gustinesses of his emotions were evident in his passionate speech.

meanings.definition: The presence of gusts or sudden bursts of wind.
meanings.sent1: We had to hold onto our hats to prevent them from flying away in the gustinesses.
meanings.sent2: The sudden gustinesses caught us off guard during our hike.
meanings.sent3: The kite soared high in the sky, carried by the gustinesses of the wind.
meanings.sent4: The gustinesses of change swept through the small town, bringing new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The gustinesses of the storm rattled the windows and doors of the old house.
